symptoms conjunctivitis: Conjunctivitis symptoms include redness, itching, tearing, and discharge from the eyes. It's often called pink eye.
what is cataract: A cataract is a clouding of the eye's natural lens, causing blurry vision, faded colors, and glare sensitivity.
cataract symptoms: Common cataract symptoms include blurry vision, trouble seeing at night, sensitivity to light, and seeing halos around lights.
eye dryness: For dry eyes, try using artificial tears, taking screen breaks, using a humidifier, and staying hydrated.
digital eye strain: To reduce digital eye strain, follow the 20-20-20 rule: every 20 minutes, look at something 20 feet away for 20 seconds.
Glaucoma info: they can include gradual loss of side (peripheral) vision, blurred vision, and seeing halos or colored rings around lights.
Age-Related Macular Degeneration (AMD) i: a disease that damages the macula (central part of the retina) and causes gradual loss of central vision.
Amblyopia (Lazy Eye) info: a condition where one eye does not develop clear vision in childhood because the brain favors the other eye.
Astigmatism info: a refractive error where the eye’s front surface is unevenly curved, causing blurry or distorted vision.
Blepharitis info: inflammation of the eyelids causing red, itchy, and swollen eyelid edges.
Color Blindness info: a condition where people have difficulty distinguishing certain colours, usually red and green.
Convergence Insufficiency info: difficulty keeping the eyes aligned when focusing on near objects, causing eyestrain or headaches.
Corneal Conditions info: problems with the clear front layer of the eye causing pain, blurred vision, or light sensitivity.
Diabetic Retinopathy info: damage to the retina’s blood vessels due to diabetes, leading to blurred or lost vision if untreated.
Dry Eye info: when eyes do not produce enough tears or good-quality tears, causing burning or irritation.
Farsightedness (Hyperopia) info: distant objects appear clear but near ones are blurry because images focus behind the retina.
Floaters info: tiny specks or cobweb-like shapes drifting across vision caused by changes in the eye’s internal fluid.
Nearsightedness (Myopia) info: near objects appear clear but distant ones look blurry because images focus in front of the retina.
Pink Eye info: also called conjunctivitis — redness, itchiness, and discharge due to infection or irritation.
Presbyopia info: age-related difficulty focusing on near objects, common after age 40.
Uveitis info: inflammation of the eye’s middle layer causing redness, pain, and blurred vision.
